events.name: Making with Light
events.description:
Learn about light. How can you harness the energy of light in your maker projects - Join our makers and get your hands dirty and learn maker skills such as using hand and power tools. 

Maker workshops are great avenues where kids (and parents) can learn more about the power to Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Maths (STEAM) and how STEAM gives our children the Power to Create. Learn about electronics, Engineering, Biology and much more through hands on, open ended exploration facilitated by passionate and enthusiastic mentors!”
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road 609081

events.name: Videography Training for Volunteers
events.description:
Free workshop for Engineers.SG volunteers and member of the tech community interested in learning about recording meetups.

Agenda:
- Intro to Engineers.SG
- Basic elements of event recording
- Introduction to our setup
- Hands-on: assemble and teardown
- Post-production tips
- General steps taken after video is uploaded to YouTube

You do not need to prepare anything. All the gear will be made available.

Email miccheng@engineers.sg if you have any questions.
events.location: HackerspaceSG, 344B King George's Avenue, King George's Building, Singapore 208576

events.name: The Future of Making in Singapore
events.description:
*Update* The original round of tickets has been sold out, we have just released an extra round of tickets. Thanks for your support!  
The crew from Autodesk Pier 9 and Instructables is coming back to Singapore! We are so encouraged by the growth of the maker and innovation scene here. This international movement is growing and evolving and sometimes it's important to take stock and see where we're going and what we want to be doing. 
The event will kick off with a series of 10-15 min talks on a range of topics, from hardware VC investments, Internet of Things devices for everyone, evolution of the maker community in Singapore, 3D printing and more!  
The speakers and topics (in no particular order) are: 


William Hooi - Espert, the entry-level IoT device  


James Chan - VC Investments into LittleBits and FormLabs 


Veera Swaminathan - Evolution of Maker Community in Singapore 


Andrew "bunnie" Huang - Youth & Disobedience: Making Future Makers  


Dr. Kiruthika Ramanathan - Making is Learning 


Saad Chinoy - Why We Make: A Geek's Perspective on Making Things Engaging  


Following the presentation session, there will be an hour long panel discussion with Eric Wilhelm (the founder of Autodesk Pier 9 and Instructables) and community leaders in Singapore to share their thoughts on what the future holds for the sunny island nation.  
Light drinks and snacks will be served post discussion (5pm), we would love to hear your thoughts and opinions and get to know you!  
We will also be holding an Instructables Show & Tell on 7th June 2016, 6 – 9pm, where we would love to see what crazy and amazing projects people have been building in Singapore! More details can be found here.
events.location: The Projector, 6001 Beach Road, Golden Mile Tower, #05-00, Singapore 199589
